data.selection_rationale: M1 and M2 have identical average MAE (1.3), but M1 was selected as the simpler baseline method. Both failed to improve over the naive forecast due to single-sample evaluation limitations.
data.method_comparison_summary: M1: MAE=1.3, M2: MAE=1.3, M3: invalid
data.winning_method_code:
def predict_naive(train_df, test_df, target_col, date_col, **params):
    import pandas as pd
    # Get last available year in training data
    last_train_year = sorted([col for col in train_df.columns if col.startswith('Area-')], reverse=True)[0]
    # Get target year to predict
    target_year = sorted([col for col in test_df.columns if col.startswith('Area-')], reverse=True)[0]
    # Use last value as prediction
    predictions = train_df[last_train_year].values
    return pd.DataFrame({'predicted': predictions}, index=test_df.index)
